title: Extensão
content:
Quero impedir que uma extensão seja removida do Firefox, porém, estou com problemas. De acordo com as políticas do Firefox no Linux, o arquivo vai para firefox/distribution, onde firefox é o diretório de instalação do firefox, que varia de acordo com a distribuição ou você pode especificar a política de todo o sistema colocando o arquivo em /etc/firefox/policies

Já tentei usando o caminho /etc/firefox/policies quanto /etc/firefox/distribution/policies e não consegui impedir que a extensão fosse removida.

Utilizo Linux Ubuntu 22.04 com Firefox instalado via pacote Snap.
creator: brunarezende671

title: TVHeadend stream not playable
content:
I have been using the TVHeadend server for many years to watch TV channels remotely via a browser. However, for years I have been forced to use blink-based web browsers because it has never been possible for Firefox to be able to watch such TV streams. Moreover, after consulting TVHeadend forums, no Linux user is able to watch such channels with Firefox and they have to use any of the other browsers.

That's why I'm asking you directly. I have all the necessary drivers and codecs on Linux to watch any kind of video and audio container and yet Firefox is unable to display the embedded video through the TVHeadend GUI.

After clicking on the TV icon in TVHeadend, the floating playback window pops up showing "An unknow error occurred" and in console, I can see the following error messages:

The HTTP "Content-Type" of "audio/mp2t" is not supported. The media resource http://192.168.1.11:9981/stream/channel/8ae0334fc3ef1e65c923582bdc53625c. extjs.html failed to load. Failed to load all candidate resources. Media loading paused. extjs.html Unable to play media. There are no decoders for the requested formats: video/MP2T, video/webm; codecs="vp8.0 vorbis", application/x-mpegURL; codecs="avc1.42E01E mp4a.40 .2", application/vnd.apple.mpegURL; codecs="avc1.42E01E mp4a.40.2", video/MP2T; codecs="avc1.42E01E mp4a.40.2", video/x-matroska; codecs="avc1.42E0

title: Certain emails are blocked using AOL on Firefox but works using AOL on Edge
content: Hi, Have been a happy user of Firefox for many years and it is my preferred browser. However, around mid 2023, I suddenly lost emails from trusted sources I signed up for like USPS Informed Delivery, ads from Publix, Harbor Freight, ALDI etc., etc. ... . Even when using the same computer running WIN10 64bit with another ISP abroad the same issue happens. Using Malwarebytes for Web protection. However, when I signed up for USPS Informed Delivery using AOL Edge, it works with daily updates. Tried to figure out if there are any filters on Firefox which could be the culprit but don't know what to look for. Appreciate any help to solve this issue. Thanks, Ben
creator: ab4ab

title: This page isn't redirecting properly (at wits' end)
content:
For a couple of months, I've been getting the error message "This page isn't redirecting properly" whenever I use Firefox. The problem doesn't seem to happen when I'm clicking on a bookmark, a saved link in Firefox's history, or a Google search result, but it happens almost every time when there is some sort of redirect involved (for example, from a link in an email newsletter to the linked website, or from a login/authentication page to the website's main page). This used to clear up after hitting "Try again" four or five times, but this week it's become stuck in an infinite loop, making some websites unusable.

I've tried the following: - Clearing cookies and cache for specific websites - Clearing cookies and cache for the entire browser - Starting Firefox in troubleshooting mode to see if the problem is with a specific extension - Deleting Firefox entirely and redownloading it - Deleting the cookies.sqlite, cookies.sqlite-shm and cookies.sqlite-wal files and restoring from a manual backup as per this answer (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1403719)

None of those have fixed the problem. Does anyone have any other ideas of what to do here? I am frustrated and out of ideas.
creator: andy.tisdel

title: Cannot access video on common sites (CBC.ca or Amazon.ca) since upgrade to 123.0.1
content:
This is a rebuilt PC after a hard drive died, Windows 10 Pro N version 22H2. and YE

I am trying to access video content on cbc.ca or Amazon.ca and receive an error message that "no compatible source was found for this media" - Amazon or on cbc.ca "Oops...None of the given sources can be played".

Prior to updating Firefox to version 123.0.1, both played video on these sites without an issue.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled FF and the issue persists. I can play the video from these sites with Chrome or Edge without a problem.

I have installed Java and have tried all of the help tips without success:

I have followed and installed recommendations from : https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/fix-video-audio-problems-firefox-windows however the latest Media Feature Pack for windows is from 2019 and is no longer applicable to the 22H2 version. https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/mediafeaturepack. Windows store does not offer the pack.

The changes suggested by https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/block-autoplay have been applied and no change

I am not running malware bytes or a VPN.

I have cleared my cache, and browsing history, rebooted = no change.

I have no add-ons, extensions or themes installed.

I prefer to use FF, but require that I can view videos from many sites.
creator: kenmorris1

title: Vídeos de YouTube
content: Desde la noche del pasado día 13 de marzo de 2024, los vídeos de YouTube no se reproducen en ninguna versión de Firefox. Sólo puede verse un mensaje que dice: «Se ha producido un error. Vuelve a intentarlo más tarde. (ID de reproducción: VNiWNSQkPtrPuDBs)». Obviamente, la ID de reproducción varía según el vídeo. El problema no ocurre con los vídeos «Shorts», sólo con los de duración normal. Mediante la extensión Easy Youtube Video Downloader, puedo descargar cualquier vídeo y verlo directamente en mi ordenador, pero esa no es la solución perfecta. También puedo copiar el vínculo, pegarlo en el navegador Safari y verlo desde ahí, pero tampoco resulta cómodo. He probado hasta la versión 123.0, pero el resultado es el mismo.

title: How does Firefox handle bookmarks and browsing history, and what tools does it provide to help users organize and manage this data?
content:
Firefox offers several features to help users organize and manage their bookmarks and browsing history effectively:

Bookmarks Manager: Firefox provides a Bookmarks Manager that allows users to view, organize, and edit their bookmarks. Users can access the Bookmarks Manager by clicking on the "Bookmarks" menu and selecting "Show All Bookmarks" or by pressing Ctrl+Shift+B (Cmd+Shift+B on macOS). In the Bookmarks Manager, users can create folders, move bookmarks between folders, rename bookmarks, and delete bookmarks.

Bookmark Toolbar: Firefox includes a Bookmark Toolbar where users can save frequently visited websites for quick access. Users can easily add bookmarks to the toolbar by clicking on the star icon in the address bar or by dragging and dropping bookmarks from the Bookmarks Manager to the toolbar.

Bookmarks Sidebar: Firefox features a Bookmarks Sidebar that allows users to access their bookmarks while browsing. Users can open the Bookmarks Sidebar by clicking on the "Bookmarks" menu and selecting "Show Bookmarks Sidebar" or by pressing Ctrl+B (Cmd+B on macOS). The Bookmarks Sidebar provides quick access to bookmarks and folders without interrupting the browsing experience.

Bookmark Tags: Firefox allows users to assign tags to bookmarks to categorize and organize them more efficiently. Tags are keywords or labels that users can add to bookmarks to make them easier to find later. Users can add tags to bookmarks when saving them or edit tags later in the Bookmarks Manager.

Smart Bookmarks: Firefox includes Smart Bookmarks, which are special bookmarks that automatically update to display dynamic content. For example, users can create Smart Bookmarks to show recently visited websites, recently bookmarked websites, or websites with specific keywords in the title or URL.

History Manager: Firefox provides a History Manager that allows users to view and manage their browsing history. Users can access the History Manager by clicking on the "History" menu and selecting "Show All History" or by pressing Ctrl+H (Cmd+H on macOS). In the History Manager, users can view their browsing history, search for specific websites, clear browsing history, and delete individual entries.
creator: Pickerwheel

title: Fav Icons
content:
I am trying to find answers in relation to my Favourites shorcuts not showing the Icon for some well known websites e.g BBC World News, CNN. Once answer found on the Firefox Forum is: Make sure that you allow pages to choose their own fonts.

Tools > Options > Content : Fonts & Colors > Advanced: [X] "Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of my selections above"

This is just typical of many answers I find on the Firefox forums whereby the suggested solutions seem to bear no resemblance to my Firefox system. Am I using something different? Everything points to me having the latest up to date version of Firefox. For example if I click on the four horizontal line hamburger on top right of the screen I do not see anything that begins with "Tools" in the menu options. I see "Settings" and "More Tools" but none lead to "Options>Content: Fonts & Colors> Advanced: [X]. simarly, If I click on "Tools" in the menu at the top of the Browser nothing leads to "Options". Any suggestions please?
